meanings.definition: The state or quality of being feasible.
meanings.sent1: The teacher discussed the feasibilities of the science experiment with the students.
meanings.sent2: The team considered the feasibilities of their project before starting.
meanings.sent3: The feasibilities of having a unicorn as a pet seemed quite amusing to the children.
meanings.sent4: The feasibilities of time travel are as elusive as catching a shooting star.
meanings.sent5: The feasibilities of finding a pot of gold at the end of a rainbow are slim, but not impossible.

meanings.definition: The likelihood of achieving success or being realized.
meanings.sent1: She was excited about the feasibilities of winning the competition.
meanings.sent2: The feasibilities of their plan coming to fruition were high.
meanings.sent3: The feasibilities of a penguin becoming a famous singer are quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The feasibilities of her dreams taking flight were as bright as the morning sun.
meanings.sent5: The feasibilities of a caterpillar turning into a butterfly are a beautiful example of transformation.

meanings.definition: The ability to be done or carried out.
meanings.sent1: The engineer assessed the feasibilities of constructing a new bridge.
meanings.sent2: They explored the feasibilities of organizing a charity event.
meanings.sent3: The feasibilities of a dog driving a car would be quite amusing to witness.
meanings.sent4: The feasibilities of a seed growing into a mighty tree are truly remarkable.
meanings.sent5: The feasibilities of a caterpillar transforming into a butterfly showcase the wonders of nature.
